pullRequest.title: GH-2540 Hacktoberfest news item
pullRequest.bodyText:
GitHub issue resolved: #2540 
Briefly describe the changes proposed in this PR:
Brief news item about Hacktoberfest with links to signup and to relevant points for getting started with RDF4J contributions.

PR Author Checklist (see the contributor guidelines for more details):

 my pull request is self-contained
 I've added tests for the changes I made
 I've applied code formatting (you can use mvn process-resources to format from the command line)
 every commit message starts with the issue number (GH-xxxx) followed by a meaningful description of the change
 every commit has been signed off

Note: we merge all feature pull requests using squash and merge. See RDF4J git merge strategy for more details.

nodes.bodyText: nit-picking here: perhaps use "earn a very snazzy T-shirt"  instead of "win" ? Feels a bit like having a low chance to actually end up with a price.
nodes.diffHunk: @@ -0,0 +1,19 @@ +--- +title: "Join us for Hacktoberfest 2020" +date: 2020-09-28T09:00:00+10:00 +layout: "single" +categories: ["news"] +--- + + + + +Hacktoberfest is a yearly event, a celebration of open source software, put together by DigitalOcean, to encourage people to start contributing to open source software. We would like to encourage you to [sign up and take part](https://hacktoberfest.digitalocean.com/)! + + + +The idea is that you contribute to an open source project, any open source project, by submitting a Pull Request (PR) to that project. If your PRs are accepted, you can win a very snazzy T-shirt, or if you prefer you can opt to plant a tree instead. See the [Hactoberfest sign up page](https://hacktoberfest.digitalocean.com/) for more details.

commit.message: GH-2540 win -> earn and rephrased requirements slightly
